oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Downtown Presbyterian Church historic marker, Nashville, Tennessee, 1977 July
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An historic marker for the Downtown Presbyterian Church that reads: “From 1814 to 1955 this was the site of the First Presbyterian Church. President Andrew Jackson was received into the church in 1838. James K. Polk was inaugurated governor here in 1839. The building designed in the Egyptian style by William Strickland, architect of the State Capitol, was dedicated in 1851. When the First Church moved, the Downtown Church was organized.” This marker is located at the intersection of 5th Ave N and Church St, on the right when traveling north on 5th Ave N. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
